items.question: What is BienBon?
items.answer: BienBon is the first anti-food waste marketplace in Mauritius. It allows consumers to buy surprise baskets at reduced prices from local businesses, thus reducing food waste.

items.question: Is BienBon available everywhere in Mauritius?
items.answer: BienBon is currently available in the main cities of Mauritius: Port-Louis, Curepipe, Quatre Bornes, Rose-Hill and Vacoas. We are progressively extending our coverage across the island.

items.question: How does a surprise basket work?
items.answer: A surprise basket contains unsold products of the day selected by the merchant. You know the category (bakery, deli, etc.) and the approximate value, but not the exact contents — that's the surprise! The price is reduced by at least 50% compared to the actual value.

items.question: How do I collect my basket?
items.answer: After your reservation, you receive a QR code in the application. Show it to the merchant within the time slot indicated during your purchase. The merchant scans your code and hands you your basket.

items.question: Can I cancel my reservation?
items.answer: Cancellations are possible up to 2 hours before the collection slot. After this time, the payment cannot be refunded as the merchant has already prepared your basket.

items.question: Is the app free?
items.answer: Yes, the BienBon application is completely free for consumers. You only pay for the price of the baskets you reserve.

items.question: How do I become a BienBon partner?
items.answer: Contact us at partners@bienbon.mu or fill in the partner registration form. Our team will contact you within 48 hours to finalize your registration and set up your account.

items.question: What types of businesses can participate?
items.answer: All food businesses can participate: bakeries, restaurants, delicatessens, grocery stores, supermarkets, cheese shops, etc. The only requirement is to have regular unsold items at the end of the day.

items.question: What commission does BienBon take?
items.answer: BienBon takes a 20% commission on each basket sold. You keep 80% of the sale price. There are no registration fees or monthly subscriptions.

items.question: What payment methods are accepted?
items.answer: BienBon accepts bank cards (Visa, Mastercard) and payments via Juice (MCB). Other local payment methods will be added soon.

items.question: When are partners paid?
items.answer: Partners receive their payments every week, every Monday for the previous week's sales. The transfer is made to the bank account registered during registration.
